column4: having a problem with mysql-server-5.0 starting on boot by default, what init scripts should i be checking?
/etc/init.d/mysql ?
i run that manually with sudo /etc/init.d/mysql start and all is fine ... just doesnt happen on startup ... what calls that on startup (im looking for that line)?
have you checked /var/log/daemon.log ?
ah nice i see an error condition after doing a cat /var/log/daemon.log | grep mysql ... i get unable to bind to 3306
the question is why tho what else would be bound to that tcp/ip port on a clean startup?
nothing
i mean i dont mind putting a call to /etc/init.d/mysql in /etc/rc.local but that just seems unclean
sudo fuser -n tcp 3306
starting mysql on rc.local is not a solution, you need to find what is binded to that port
the thing is nothing because if i run the script manually after clean boot it succeeds
that is something broken on your startup :P
i am binding to my nated ip address 192.168.1.101 ... maybe i dont have that address until after the first attempt happens?
that maybe the case
if the port was already in use you should get such error "already in use", so most likely the address is not yet available
so my fix is to stop using dhcp and maybe switch to static?
oh, mysql with dchp :P ?
that's a rare combination
well i have it setup so my dhcp server gives the same everytime but thats a hack
based on MAC requesting the dhcp address from dhcpd
